arabicText: إِنَّهُمْ لَهُمُ ٱلْمَنصُورُونَ
englishTranslationText: That	undoubtedly,	only	they	will	be	helped.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	be-shak	unhiñ	ki	madad	hogi.

arabicText: وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	surely,	only	Our	army	will	be	victorious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Hamārā	hi	lashkar	ghālib	āaye	gā.

arabicText: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Therefore	turn	away	from	them	for	some	time.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	aik	waqt	tak	tum	un	se	moñh	pher	lo.

arabicText: وَأَبْصِرْهُمْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	watch	them,	for	they	will	soon	see.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unheñ	dekhte	raho	ke	'anqarib	woh	dekheñ	ge.

arabicText: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	are	they	being	impatient	for	Our	punishment?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	Hamāre	'aƶāb	ki	jaldi	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	it	does	descend	in	their	courtyards	–	so	what	an	evil	morning	it	will	be	for	those	who	
were	warned!
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jab	utre	gā	un	ke	āañgan	meiñ	to	darāye	gaye’oñ	ki	kyā	hi	buri	subaḥ	hogi.

arabicText: وَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	turn	away	from	them	for	some	time.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	aik	waqt	tak	un	se	moñh	pher	lo.

arabicText: وَأَبْصِرْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	wait,	for	they	will	soon	see.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	intizār	karo	ke	woh	'anqarib	dekheñ	ge.

arabicText: سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText: Purity	is	to	your	Lord,	the	Lord	of	Honour,	from	all	what	they	say.
romanUrduTranslationText: Pāki	hai	tumhāre	Rab	ko	'izzat	wāle	rab	ko	un	ki	baton	se.

arabicText: وَسَلَـٰمٌ عَلَى ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	peace	is	upon	the	Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Salām	hai	Paighambaroñ	par.	.

arabicText: وَٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	all	praise	is	to	Allah,	the	Lord	of	the	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	sab	khoobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	jo	sāre	jahāñ	kā	Rab	hai.

arabicText: صٓ ۚ وَٱلْقُرْءَانِ ذِى ٱلذِّكْرِ
englishTranslationText:
Şād*	-	By	oath	of	the	renowned	Qur’an,	
(*Alphabet of the Arabic language; Allah 
and to whomever He reveals, know their 
precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Şād*	-	is	nāmwar	Qurān	ki	Qasam 
(*Arabi zabān ka Harf jiske Ma’āni Allah or 
Jis par Allah Ta’āla ne Nazil Farmaya Wahi 
Janta hai.)

arabicText: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى عِزَّةٍۢ وَشِقَاقٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
In	fact,	the	disbelievers	are	in	false	pride	
and	opposition.
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	kāfir	takabbur	aur	khilāf	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن قَرْنٍۢ فَنَادَوا۟ وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Many	a	generation	We	did	destroy	before	
them	–	thereupon	they	cried	out	whereas	
it	is	not	the	time	to	escape!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	un	se	pahle	kitni	sangateñ	
khapāyiñ	to	ab	woh	pukāreñ	aur	chootne	
kā	waqt	na	thā.

arabicText: وَعَجِبُوٓا۟ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا سَـٰحِرٌۭ كَذَّابٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	were	surprised	that	a	Herald	of	
Warning	came	to	them	from	among	
themselves;	and	the	disbelievers	said,	“He	
is	a	magician,	a	great	liar!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheñ	is	kā	achanbā	(t'ajjub)	huā	ke	in	
ke	pās	unhiñ	meiñ	kā	aik	dar	sunāne	wālā	
tashrif		lāyā	aur	kāfir	bole	ye	jādu-gar	hai	
badā	jhootā.

arabicText: أَجَعَلَ ٱلْـَٔالِهَةَ إِلَـٰهًۭا وَٰحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَىْءٌ عُجَابٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“Has	he	made	all	the	Gods	into	One	God?	
This	is	really	something	very	strange!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā		us	ne	bahut	khudāōñ	kā	aik	khudā	kar	
diyā?	Be-shak	ye	'ajeeb	bāt	hai.

arabicText: وَٱنطَلَقَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ ٱمْشُوا۟ وَٱصْبِرُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَىْءٌۭ يُرَادُ
englishTranslationText:
And	their	leaders	went	about,	“Leave	him	
and	cling	steadfastly	to	your	Gods!	Indeed	
he	has	a	hidden	objective	in	this!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	ke	sardār	chale	ke	is	ke	pās	se	
chal	do	aur	apne	khudāōñ	par	sābir	raho	
be-shak	us	meiñ	is	kā	koyi	maṭlab	hai.

arabicText: مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِى ٱلْمِلَّةِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا ٱخْتِلَـٰقٌ
englishTranslationText:
“We	never	heard	of	this	even	in	
Christianity,	the	latest	religion;	this	is	
clearly	a	newly	fabricated	matter.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	to	ham	ne	sab	se	pichle	Deen	Nasrāniyat	
meiñ	bhi	na	suni	ye	to	niri	nayi	gadhat	hai.

arabicText: أَءُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلذِّكْرُ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى شَكٍّۢ مِّن ذِكْرِى ۖ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِ ٨
englishTranslationText:
“Is	the	Qur’an	which	is	sent	to	him,	among	
us?”	In	fact	they	are	in	a	doubt	concerning	
My	Book;	in	fact,	they	have	not	yet	tasted	
My	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā		in	par	Qur’ān	utārā	gayā	ham	sab	meiñ	se	balke	woh	shak	meiñ	haiñ	meri	kitāb	se	balke	abhi	
meri	mār	nahiñ	chakhi	hai.

arabicText: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَآئِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْوَهَّابِ
englishTranslationText: Or	do	they	hold	the	treasures	of	the	mercy	of	your	Lord,	the	Almighty,	the	Great	Bestower?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā		woh	tumhāre	Rab	ki	Raḥmat	ke	khazānchi	haiñ	woh	'izzat	wālā	bahut	'aṭā	farmāne	wālā.

arabicText: أَمْ لَهُم مُّلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَلْيَرْتَقُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَسْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
Is	the	kingdom	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	all	that	is	between	them,	for	them?	So	would	
they	not	just	ascend	using	ropes?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	un	ke	liye	hai	salṭanat	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	ki	aur	jo	kuch	in	ke	darmiyān	hai	to	rassiyāñ	
latkā	kar	chadh	na	jāyeñ.

arabicText: جُندٌۭ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَحْزَابِ
englishTranslationText: This	is	just	one	of	the	disgraced	armies,	that	will	be	routed	there	and	then.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ye	aik	ƶalil	lashkar	hai	unhiñ	lashkaroñ	meiñ	se	jo	wahiñ	bhagā	diyā	jāye	gā.

arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍۢ وَعَادٌۭ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو ٱلْأَوْتَادِ
englishTranslationText: Before	them,	the	people	of	Nooh	had	denied,	and	the	tribe	of	A’ad,	and	Firaun	who	used	to	crucify
romanUrduTranslationText: In	se	pahle	jhutlā	chuke	haiñ	Nūḥ	ki	qaum	aur	'Āad	aur	chaumekhā	karne	wālā	fir'aun.

arabicText: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍۢ وَأَصْحَـٰبُ لْـَٔيْكَةِ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ
englishTranslationText: And	the	tribe	of	Thamud,	and	the	people	of	Lut,	and	the	People	of	the	Woods;	these	are	the	groups.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Samood	aur	Lūṭ	ki	qaum	aur	ban	wāle	ye	haiñ	woh	giroh.

arabicText: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ
englishTranslationText:
None	of	them	was	such	that	it	did	not	deny	the	Noble	Messengers,	therefore	My	punishment	
became	inevitable.
romanUrduTranslationText: In	meiñ	koyi	aisā	nahiñ	jis	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	na	jhutlāyā	ho	to	merā	'aƶāb	lāzim	huā.

arabicText: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٍۢ
englishTranslationText: They	await	just	one	Scream,	which	no	one	can	avert.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ye	rāh	nahiñ	dekhte	magar	aik	chikh	ki	jise	koyi	pher	nahiñ	saktā.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText: And	they	said,	“Our	Lord!	Give	us	our	share	quickly,	before	the	Day	of	Reckoning.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bole	aey	hamāre	rab!	hamārā	ḥissa	hameñ	jald	de	de	ḥisāb	ke	din	se	pahle.

arabicText: ٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُۥدَ ذَا ٱلْأَيْدِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
englishTranslationText:
Have	patience	upon	what	they	say,	and	
remember	Our	bondman	Dawud,	the	one	
blessed	with	favours;	he	is	indeed	most	
inclined	(towards	His	Lord).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	in	ki	batoñ	par	sabr	karo	aur	Hamāre	
bande	Dāwood	n'ematoñ	wāle	ko	yād	karo	
be-shak	woh	badā	ruju'	karne	wālā	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا ٱلْجِبَالَ مَعَهُۥ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ وَٱلْإِشْرَاقِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	subjected	the	hills	to	say	the	
praise	with	him,	at	night	and	at	morn.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Ham	ne	us	ke	sāth	pahārd	
musakhkhar	farmā	diye	ke	tasbiḥ	karte	
sham	ko	aur	suraj	chamakte.

arabicText: وَٱلطَّيْرَ مَحْشُورَةًۭ ۖ كُلٌّۭ لَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	birds	gathered	together;	they	were	all	
obedient	to	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	parinde	jam'a	kiye	huye	sab	us	ke	
farmāñbardār	the.

arabicText: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُۥ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ ٱلْخِطَابِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	strengthened	his	kingdom	and	
gave	him	wisdom	and	just	speech.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	us	ki	salṭanat	ko	mazbooṭ	kiyā		
aur	usey	ḥikmat	aur	Qaul-e-Faisal	diyā.

arabicText: ۞ وَهَلْ أَتَىٰكَ نَبَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا۟ ٱلْمِحْرَابَ
englishTranslationText:
And	did	the	news	of	the	two	disputants	
reach	you?	When	they	scaled	over	the	wall	
into	Dawud’s	masjid.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	tumheñ	us	d'awe	wāloñ	ki	bhi	
khabar	āayi	jab	woh	diwār	kood	kar	
Dāwood	ki	Masjid	meiñ	āaye.

arabicText: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَىٰ دَاوُۥدَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ فَٱحْكُم بَيْنَنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَٱهْدِنَآ إِلَىٰ سَوَآءِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ
englishTranslationText:
When	they	entered	upon	David,	so	he	
feared	them	-	they	said,	“Do	not	fear!	We	
are	two	disputants,	one	of	whom	has	
wronged	the	other,	therefore	judge	fairly	
between	us	and	do	not	judge	unjustly	-	and	
show	us	the	right	way.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	woh	Dāwood	par	dākhil	huye	to	woh	un	
se	ghabrā	gayā	unhoñ	ne	'arz	ki	dariye	
nahiñ	ham	do	fareeq	haiñ	ke	aik	ne	doosre	
par	ziyādati	ki	hai	to	ham	meiñ	sachchā	
faisla	farmā	dijiye	aur	khilāf-e-ḥaq	na	
kijiye	aur	hameñ	sidhi	rāh	batāiye.

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَآ أَخِى لَهُۥ تِسْعٌۭ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةًۭ وَلِىَ نَعْجَةٌۭ وَٰحِدَةٌۭ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِى فِى ٱلْخِطَابِ
englishTranslationText:
“This	is	my	brother;	he	has	ninety	nine	
ewes	and	I	have	one	ewe;	and	he	now	says	
‘Give	that	one	also	to	me’	-	and	he	is	very	
demanding	in	speech.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ye	merā	bhāyi	hai	is	ke	pās	
ninniyānwe	dumbiyāñ	haiñ	aur	mere	pās	
aik	dumbi	ab	ye	kahtā	hai	woh	bhi	mujhe	
ḥawāle	kar	de	aur	bāt	meiñ	mujh	par	zor	
dāltā	hai.

arabicText: قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِۦ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْخُلَطَآءِ لَيَبْغِى بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَقَلِيلٌۭ مَّا هُمْ ۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُۥدُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّـٰهُ فَٱسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُۥ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًۭا وَأَنَابَ ۩
englishTranslationText:
Said	Dawud,	“He	is	indeed	being	unjust	to	
you	in	that	he	demands	to	add	your	ewe	to	
his	ewes;	and	indeed	most	partners	wrong	
one	another,	except	those	who	believe	and	
do	good	deeds	-	and	they	are	very	few!”	
Thereupon	Dawud	realised	that	We	had	tested	him,	so	he	sought	forgiveness	from	his	Lord,	and	
fell	prostrate	and	inclined	(towards	his	Lord).	(Command	of	Prostration	#	10)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Dāwood	ne	farmāyā	be-shak	ye	tujh	par	
ziyādati	kartā	hai	ke	teri	dumbi	apni	
dumbiyoñ	meiñ	milāne	ko	māñgtā	hai	aur	
be-shak	aksar	sājhe	wāle	aik	dosre	par	
ziyādati	karte	haiñ	magar	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achchhe	kām	kiye	aur	woh	bahut	thode	haiñ	ab	
Dāwood		samjhā	ke	ham	ne	ye	us	ki	jānch	ki	thi	to	apne	Rab	se	mu'āafi	māñgi	aur	Sajde	meiñ	gir	
padā	aur	ruju'	lāyā.	(Sajde	ka	Hukm	#10)

arabicText: فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُۥ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَـَٔابٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	forgave	him	this;	and	indeed	for	him	in	Our	presence	are,	surely,	proximity	and	an	
excellent	abode.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Ham	ne	usey	ye	mu'āaf	farmā	diyā	aur	be-shak	us	ke	liye	Hamāri	bārgāh	meiñ	zaroor	qurb	aur	
achchhā	thikānā	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰدَاوُۥدُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَـٰكَ خَلِيفَةًۭ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱحْكُم بَيْنَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ شَدِيدٌۢ بِمَا نَسُوا۟ يَوْمَ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText:
“O	Dawud!	We	have	indeed	appointed	you	as	a	Viceroy	in	the	earth,	therefore	judge	between	
mankind	with	the	truth,	and	do	not	follow	desire	for	it	will	lead	you	astray	from	Allah’s	path;	
indeed	for	those	who	stray	away	from	Allah’s	path	is	a	severe	punishment,	because	they	forgot	
the	Day	of	Reckoning.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Dāwood!		Be-shak	Ham	ne	tujhe	zameen	meiñ	nāib	kiyā	to	logoñ	meiñ	sachchhā	ḥukm	kar	
aur	khwāhish	ke	piche	na	jānā	ke	tumhe	Allāh	ki	rāh	se	bahkā	de	gi	be-shak	woh	jo	Allāh	ki	rāh	
de	bahakte	haiñ	un	ke	liye	sakht	'aƶāb	hai	is	par	ke	woh	ḥisāb	ke	din	ko	bhol	baithe.

arabicText: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَـٰطِلًۭا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ۚ فَوَيْلٌۭ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	not	created	the	heaven	and	
the	earth	and	all	that	is	between	them	
without	purpose;	this	is	what	the	
disbelievers	assume;	therefore	ruin	is	for	
the	disbelievers,	by	the	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	āasmān	aur	zameen	aur	jo	
kuchh	in	ke	darmiyān	hai	bekār	na	banāye	
ye	kāfiroñ	kā	gumān	hai	to	kāfiroñ	ki	
kharābi	hai	āag	se.

arabicText: أَمْ نَجْعَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ كَٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ كَٱلْفُجَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
Shall	We	make	those	who	believe	and	do	
good	deeds	equal	to	those	who	spread	
turmoil	in	the	earth?	Or	shall	We	equate	
the	pious	with	the	disobedient?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā		Ham	unheñ	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achchhe	
kām	kiye	un	jaisā	kar	deñ	jo	zameen	meiñ	
fasād	phailāte	haiñ	yā	ham	parhez-gāroñ	
ko	sharir	be-ḥukmoñ	ke	barābar	thahrā	
deñ.

arabicText: كِتَـٰبٌ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَـٰرَكٌۭ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	a	Book	which	We	have	sent	down	
upon	you,	a	blessed	Book,	for	them	to	
ponder	upon	its	verses,	and	for	men	of	
intellect	to	accept	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	aik	kitāb	hai	ke	Ham	ne	tumhāri	ṭaraf	
utāri	barkat	wāli	take	is	ki	Āayatoñ	ko	
soñcheñ	aur	'aql	mand	nasiḥat	māneñ.

arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُۥدَ سُلَيْمَـٰنَ ۚ نِعْمَ ٱلْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	Dāwood	ko	Sulaimān	'aṭā	
farmāyā	kyā	achchhā	banda	be-shak	woh	
bahut	ruju'a	lāne	wālā.

arabicText: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ ٱلصَّـٰفِنَـٰتُ ٱلْجِيَادُ
englishTranslationText:
When	eager,	fast	footed	steeds	were	
presented	to	him	at	evening.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jabke	us	par	pesh	kiye	gaye	tisre	pahar	ko	
ke	rokiye	to	tin	pāoñ	par	khade	hoñ	
chauthe	sum	kā	kināra	zameen	par	lagāye	
huye	aur	chalāiye	to	hawā	ho	jāyeñ.

arabicText: فَقَالَ إِنِّىٓ أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ ٱلْخَيْرِ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّى حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِٱلْحِجَابِ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	Sulaiman	said,	“I	cherish	the	love	
of	these	horses	*,	out	of	remembrance	of	my	
Lord”;	he	then	ordered	them	to	be	raced	
until	they	vanished	in	a	curtain	out	of	sight.	
(To	be	used	in	holy	war.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Sulaimān	ne	kahā	mujhe	in	ghodoñ	ki	
muḥābbat	pasand	āayi	hai	apne	rab	ki	yād	
ke	liye	phir	unheñ	chalāne	kā	ḥukm	diyā	
yahāñ	tak	ke	nigāh	se	parde	meiñ	chip	gaye.

arabicText: رُدُّوهَا عَلَىَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًۢا بِٱلسُّوقِ وَٱلْأَعْنَاقِ
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	ḥukm	diyā	ke	unheñ	mere	pās	lāō	to	un	ki	pindliyoñ	aur	gardanoñ	par	hath	pherne	lagā.

arabicText: رُدُّوهَا عَلَىَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًۢا بِٱلسُّوقِ وَٱلْأَعْنَاقِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	indeed	tested	Sulaiman,	and	
placed	a	dead	body	on	his	throne	–	he	therefore	inclined	towards	His	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Sulaimān	ko	jāñchā	aur	us	ke	takht	par	aik	be-jān	badan	dāl	diyā	phir	ruju'	
lāyā.

arabicText: رُدُّوهَا عَلَىَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًۢا بِٱلسُّوقِ وَٱلْأَعْنَاقِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	indeed	tested	Sulaiman,	and	
placed	a	dead	body	on	his	throne	–	he	therefore	inclined	towards	His	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Sulaimān	ko	jāñchā	aur	us	ke	takht	par	aik	be-jān	badan	dāl	diyā	phir	ruju'	
lāyā.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَـٰنَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِۦ جَسَدًۭا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord!	Forgive	me	and	bestow	upon	me	a	kingdom,	which	shall	not	befit	anyone	after	
me;	indeed	only	You	are	the	Great	Bestower.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Àrz	ki	aey	mere	Rab!	Mujhe	bakhsh	de	aur	mujhe	aisi	salṭanat	'aṭā	kar	ke	mere	b'ad	kisi	ko	lāiq	
na	ho	be-shak	to	hi	hai	badi	dain	wālā.
